summary: "Jaws" is a 1975 thriller film directed by Steven Spielberg, based on Peter Benchley's novel. It stars Roy Scheider as Chief Brody, who teams up with a biologist and a shark hunter to catch a great white shark terrorizing a beach town. The film was groundbreaking for being shot mostly in the ocean, though production was challenging. Spielberg used a minimalist approach, suggesting the shark's presence with an ominous theme by composer John Williams. Released in over 450 theaters, "Jaws" was a huge success, becoming the highest-grossing film until "Star Wars" and influencing modern Hollywood's focus on summer blockbusters. It's now preserved in the U.S. National Film Registry.
title: Jaws (film)
